threads.text: Multitasking is great and fast! I juggle my games (Magic Rush and Pokemon Go) with  no restarting at all. Double tapping the recents button is a sweet feat to quickly switch between apps without going to the recents page.

It sometimes lags abit especially when just starting ot when you wake the phone after long standby (half to one hour etc).  Other than that it usually is ok, though noticeably slower compared to the pixel and op3

Cheese! 10/10 for camera.  Average of .76 seconds for camera launch to take a picture with shutter button. 




Don't know how to post pictures with full quality though.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IV9zVcxi_HU

https://m.dpreview.com/news/33265832...mobile-ranking

http://www.slashgear.com/sony-xperia...view-01450018/


http://www.manilashaker.com/sony-xpe...camera-review/

I've seen no one around internet taking about the fornt facing camera having autofocus. Im not sure but none of the flagships have this feature wich is awesome. Not only many mpx, but the hability to focus the front camera gives such detailed pics.

still think the xa ultra does a better job but i mean they have the wide angle lense and the extra 3 mpg's on the side. In light this phone does great. Low light, I havent found the right combination of settings to not get a blurry one

title: Time to take picture (camera launch speed)

threads.text: First hour was very fast, but then took another hour to do the last 20%, which I've not seen from a phone before.

replies.text:
It is made that way to make the battery live longer 



---------- Post added at 06:57 AM ---------- Previous post was at 06:55 AM ----------

I am not disappointed,  it charges fast and compared to years before I can now forget to charge in time and still be able to use the phone for a longer period

threads.text: An hour for the last 20%?  Really?  As I said, I've not seen it that slow before.
Battery is bad, after the nougat update is noticeably worse. Without the lowest stamina mode setting, the battery counter drops like a countdown clock
Quality is nice and hand feel is great but the back plate really vibrates like crazy when using the speaker.
It's built nicely, but the screen is really prone to scratches. Still waiting for my cover, and it's going downhill
Some stock elements in there.
Scored 650 lux on my meter.  Some Samsungs get up to the high 800's

I see small dots of black all over the screen when I have a white background,  not exactly visible but when looking close it is there. Maybe it is something to do with the technology in the screen. 

My wife can't see it but it sure annoys me from time to time

replies.text: would you call those dead pixels

No as it is not the whole pixel, it shows when looking close.
From a distance the screen is great though.

threads.text:
wifi in my device is worst than ever sony devices (xz, xz1, xz ultra, xz2, xz3c, xz3 not mention non z series)

wifi is connected but no internet (when internet OK - superslow)

and I have to mention about vibrating engine - it's very loud (like bad mounted)
WIFI not particularly good on mine either. Walls cause a problem when Z5 has no problem keeping strong signal
My z2 has 2bars and my Xp has 0bars 😢

I concur XP worse then z5c. Finding I have to manually connect to my WiFi networks it won't auto connect most of the time which is even more annoying than the weaker WiFi connection which is also occurring.

I was hoping this would have been fixed by now, but it seems to still be a problem. I got my XP a few days ago and I'm having a lot of issues with the WiFi at work.

If I put my XP next to my Z3C on my desk, the Z3C has full signal and the XP struggles to even keep the connection alive. The signal indicator in the status bar hits rock bottom and apps lose connectivity. It also won't connect automatically when I get to work.
I installed all the available updates immediately after booting the phone, so I don't know if the problem was introduced in any of those. I'm on Nougat, build 39.2.A.0.442 now.
Maybe worth noting: When downloading the updates I put the phone in the same place it's having problems now, but it had no problems downloading them.

Has anyone found a fix for this? Factory reset? Send the phone back for service/replacement?

EDIT: Factory reset did not help for me at all. The signal strength seemed fine when I booted into safe mode, but it didn't stay that way after I did another factory reset after that.

RE:  X speakerphone: 
My prior posted issue resolved. I deleted that part as issue is very unlikely to happen to others. Ive made several successful calls since then on Xperia X speakerphone. We got this phone to aid in serious injury recovery: re: speakerphone & cam quality VS Z3 or other phones. 

Very impressed. Best speakerphone Ive ever used, will compare to my Z3 when I replace Z3 screen. I rate speakerphone: 5 stars. "Flawless victory."  Thx, XDA. I look fwd to future posts.
